ACC: IOCL // 27 TMT CPP // PARADIP TO CHATTOGRAM // 01-02 SEPT
OFFERS DUE 1500 HRS INDIA /  1030 HRS LONDON / 1730 HRS SINGAPORE  TODAY
Account:       IOCL
CARGO:         1 / 2 Grades of  Clean Petroleum Products (Intn. Gas oil/ Gasoline / Any other CPP GRADE)
QUANTITY:   Min. 27TMT Choption upto full capacity of vessel.
LOAD PORT: 1/2/3 SP/SB/SA/STS Paradip
DISPORT :     1/2/3 SP/SB/SA/STS Chattogram
LAYCAN  :    01-02.09.2024
LAYTIME:      216 hours (bss 1:1). Additional 12 hours for each additional port.
COMM. :      3.75% TTL HERE INCLUDING 2.50% ADCOM TO CHTRS
OTHER INFORMATION FOR OWNERS GUIDANCE ONLY:
PORT COST (FOR 45KT VESSEL) :-
PARADIP- APPROX $26000
CHATTOGRAM - APPROX $ 55000
// //
ENQUIRY
Enquiry No. 24/08/185                                                                                                     Date: 27.08.2024
Indian Oil Corporation Limited invites best offers against the following enquiry as per the terms and conditions
stated herein.
OFFER FORM
1
OWNER’S OFFER
1.1
Owners offer (Firm / Sub-Open)
1.2
Offer validity
1.3
(a) Disp. Owner / Comm. operator
(b) Nationality of the Owner
1.4
Broker
1.5
Freight (LS in USD) :
All Inclusive - including port charges at load port & disport, tonnage dues, pipeline dues, coastal conversion and reversion cost, AWRP.  All expenses will form part of agreed freight and no separate reimbursement shall be made, whatsoever.
1.6
Demurrage (USD - PDPR)
1.7
Vessel details- as per updated Q88 :
1.8
Vessel name
1.9
Detail itinerary
1.10
Sire Details
(Date / Insp. Agency / Operation)
1.11
(a) Built (full date)
(Vessel should be less than 20 years of age as on the date of delivery of cargo at disport, which is to be calculated as 15 days beyond the last day of loading lay days)
(b) CAP
(c) P&I Club
(d) Flag
1.12
Last 3 Cargoes
All consequences including costs arising out of mis-declaration shall be on Owner's account.
1.13
No. of days for which the Vessel was employed for Indian coastal business in the current calendar year
(applicable for Foreign Flag Vessels only)
1.14
Remarks, if any
1.15
Owner’s Confirm that:
a)
i) The vessel is not Iranian Flag.
ii) Owners (Registered, Technical, Commercial and Disponent) of the vessel and freight /demurrage beneficiaries of the payment should not be of Iranian origin and should not be featuring in US OFAC / UN/EU sanction list presently or in the past.
iii) The intermediary bank and beneficiary bank should be ready to handle the remittance despite their earlier Iranian port call / any other port in OFAC sanctioned countries (if any) by the vessel  for affording credit to the beneficiary subject to local laws, regulations, internal compliance policies etc.
iv) The vessel/ any ownerships of vessel as mentioned above is not in US OFAC / UN/EU sanction list and also should not have featured in US OFAC / UN/EU sanction list in the past.
v)    All foreign exchange transactions shall be in compliance with US OFAC / EU/UN regulations.
vi) In case overseas corresponding bank/ IOCL bank asks for further details owners shall provide those details.
In case of any mis-declaration on any of the above, the vessel owner shall be liable for any delay or additional cost incurred by IOCL for settling the freight and demurrage payments.
IB)  I) OWNERS / BROKERS TO INDICATE IN THEIR OFFER THAT VESSEL, FLAG AND OWNER/S (REGISTERED, DISPONENT, COMMERCIAL, TECHNICAL OPERATORS) INCLUDING FREIGHT BENEFICIARIES OF THE PAYMENT DOES NOT BELONG TO A COUNTRY WHICH SHARES A LAND BORDER WITH INDIA AS STIPULATED VIDE  GOVERNMENT OF INDIA, DEPARTMENT OF EXPENDITURE OFFICE MEMORANDUM DATED 23.7.2020 ON INSERTION OF RULE 144(XI) IN THE GFR 2017 AND ORDER (PUBLIC PROCUREMENT NO.1) DATED 23.7.2020 VIDE F.NO.6/18/2019-PPD GIVING DETAILED GUIDELINES ON RESTRICTIONS ON PUBLIC PROCUREMENT FROM COUNTRIES WHICH SHARE A LAND BORDER WITH INDIA.
II)        IN CASE OF ANY OF THE OFFERS RECEIVED FROM COUNTRIES RESTRICTED AS PER THE ABOVE AFOREMENTIONED GUIDELINES, THE OFFER IS LIABLE FOR REJECTION UNLESS SUCH PARTIES ARE REGISTERED WITH REGISTRATION COMMITTEE CONSTITUTED BY THE DEPARTMENT FOR PROMOTION OF INDUSTRY AND INTERNAL TRADE (DPIIT). THESE BIDDERS SHALL ENSURE THAT THEY HAVE VALID REGISTRATION AS ABOVE ON THE DUE DATE OF ENQUIRY.
III)        IN CASE OF ANY MIS-DECLARATION BY A BIDDER ON ANY OF THE ABOVE, THIS WILL BE A GROUND FOR TAKING ACTION AGAINST THOSE BIDDERS / VESSELS / OWNERS AS PER IOCL LAID DOWN PROCEDURES.
IV)        TENDERERS MUST SUBMIT MODEL CERTIFICATE CERTIFYING: “I HAVE READ THE CLAUSE REGARDING RESTRICTIONS ON PROCUREMENT FROM A BIDDER OF A COUNTRY WHICH SHARES A LAND BORDER WITH INDIA; I CERTIFY THAT THIS BIDDER IS NOT FROM SUCH A COUNTRY OR, IF FROM SUCH A COUNTRY, HAS BEEN REGISTERED WITH THE COMPETENT AUTHORITY. I HEREBY CERTIFY THAT THIS BIDDER FULFILLS ALL REQUIREMENTS IN THIS REGARD AND IS ELIGIBLE TO BE CONSIDERED. [WHERE APPLICABLE, EVIDENCE OF VALID REGISTRATION BY THE COMPETENT AUTHORITY SHALL BE ATTACHED.]”
b)
The following clause is applicable for foreign flag vessels which have completed one Indian coastal voyage in the current calendar year and going to perform next Indian coastal voyage in the same calendar year:
(i) If a Foreign Flag Vessel’s license period / voyage period exceeds 30 days but upto and including 90 days, a minimum of 1 /3 rd of the Crew (Officers and ratings)engaged on board as per the Safe Manning  norm  or actual deployment, whichever is higher, who are holding relevant Indian Certificates, shall be deployed.
(ii) If a Foreign Flag Vessel’s license period / voyage period exceeds 90 days, one half of the Crew (Officers and ratings)engaged on board as per the Safe Manning  norm  or actual deployment, whichever is higher, who are holding relevant Indian Certificates, shall be deployed.
In both the cases at Para (i) & (ii) above, 15% of the Indian crew so engaged shall be trainee cadets / officers distributed equally (to the extent possible) between the navigational and engineering sides, respectively.
2.0
CARGO DETAILS
2.1
Cargo:
1 / 2 Grades of  Clean Petroleum Products (Intn. Gas Oil /  Gasoline  / Any other CPP grade)
2.2
Quantity:
Min. 27 TMT Choption upto full capacity of vessel.
The two cargo grades/quantities to be loaded in different groups of tanks with positive/double valve segregation between the tank groups.
Confirm vessel able to load minimum quantity basis draft restriction at load port & disport. If the vessel is unable to lift the minimum quantity as mentioned above, dead freighting shall be on owner's account.
2.3
Load port:
1/2/3 SP/SB/SA/STS     Paradip
2.4
Disport:
1/2/3 SP/SB/SA/STS     Chattogram, Bangladesh
2.5
Laycan:
01- 02.09.2024 (TBN 01 Day Choption)
2.6
2nd Voyage:
CHOPTION SECOND VOYAGE IN DIRECT CONTINUATION  DELETE
2.7
Laytime:
216 hours (bss 1:1). Additional 12 hours for each additional port.
3.0
​
SPECIAL TERMS
3.1
Tank Cleaning:
Vessel to accept IOCL cleaning code as per enclosed “ Tankers Tank Cleaning Key”  or as per instructions given for tank cleaning along with voyage order.
3.2
Flushing:
After completion of MS discharge, vessel shall flush the dock line with water.
3.3
Dock line Content:
Vessel to prepare groups for loading  cargo at LOADPORT  and keep one group ready to receive Dock Line content at DISPORT (S). The dock line content  received at DISPORT (prior to discharge of cargo) will be discharged back in dock line to maintain the dock line status as it is.
3.4
Paradip SOJ Requirement:
For connecting the marine loading arm at south oil jetty, the performing vessel should have flange of standard 150 lbs ANSI B 16.5.  The performing vessel should carry a suitable flange of 16 inch diameter with thickness 36.5 mm.  Any delay caused to the performing vessel due to vessel having non standard flange shall be to the owners account.
3.5
Haldia Port Requirement:
Vessel must also have minimum 22 polypropylene ropes of 220m lengths each. Out of these 22 ropes, maximum 4 can be wires with long rope tails (minimum 20 m).
3.6
ATF Loading:
For ATF loading, the groups nominated are required to be flushed with 1.0-1.2 TMT ATF, which after rinsing/cleaning at berth will be shifted to other tank nominated for DGATF/SKO loading.
3.7
Orange dye dosing
Owners confirm: “Manual Orange dye dosing will be done (after partial loading of white MS) in nominated MS tanks on board the vessel in case of MS loading AT LOADPORT”.
3.5
DISPORT (CHATTOGRAM) REQUIREMENTS:
Vessel should not be of Israeli registration.
2.      Vessel should be of double-hull type.
3.      Vessel should have LOA less than 186 m and should be dimensionally acceptable at Chattogram port.
4.      Vessel should be less than 20 years of age as on the date of delivery, which is to be calculated as 15 days beyond the last day of loading laydays.
5.      Vessel should have minimum discharging rate of 700 MT per hour through one line.
6.      Vessel should be able to load the minimum quantity each grade basis loadports / disports restrictions and arrive at the customary Chattogram outer anchorage. On arrival at Chattogram outer anchorage vessel shall be lightered by Buyer’s vessel (if needed) in order to attain the required draft for berthing at Chattogram port. Draft available for berthing at Chattogram port is 23-30 feet or 7-9 metres. Vessel should be able to berth safely either directly or with the reduced draft after lighterage operation. Owners to arrange for fendors and any other equipment required for lighterage operation at Chattogram port at Owner’s time and cost.
7. Vessel must have positive segregation. The two different grades of cargo are to be                                                                                                loaded in two different groups of tanks with positive/double valve segregation at all time during loading, in transit and during discharge.
8. Slop tanks should be clean and kept empty throughout the entire voyage, no cargo is to be loaded in the slop tanks.
9. Vessel master to prepare cargo stowage plan based on the information provided in the voyage order, taking into account the restrictions at the load ports / terminals and discharge ports / terminals and ensure compliance at all time.
10. In case night navigation is not permitted by port authorities / Govt. Regulations, NOR if tendered after 17:00 hrs local time & upto 06:00 hrs local time of the following day, shall be deemed to have been tendered at 06:00 hrs local time of the following day.
11. Please share Q88, VEF for at least 10 latest voyages, VEF (not over 1.0003), details of last three cargoes loaded etc. Vessel shall be ISPS compliant.
4.0
OTHER TERMS
4.1
Charter Party:
As per IOC amended ASBATANKVOY with rider clauses as used for products (attached herewith).
Rider Clause no. 2 stands deleted for this fixture:
Rider Clause no. 2: It is understood and agreed that all Worldscale terms and conditions shall apply to this Charter Party as at date of Bill of Lading.
4.2
Port Requirements:
Vessel should meet port limitations / requirements / conditions at Loadport(s) & disport(s).
4.3
Night Navigation:
If there is no night navigation at Loadport / Disport and the vessel neither arrives after 6pm, NOR shall deemed to be tendered not before 6 am of next day whether or not the vessel is on demurrage.
4.4
MARPOL Regulations:
Vessel should meet latest MARPOL regulations, which have come into force with effect from 5th April 2005.
4.5
War Risk Clause:
Chevron war risk clause to apply.
4.6
ISSC/ISPS:
Vessel must have valid ISSC. Chevron ISPS clause to apply.
4.7
B/L’s
B/L’s to be issued as per terminal procedures /requirements. However, separate invoices and B/L’s are to be provided against the cargo as per charterers’ requirement, which shall be advised to the owner’s prior cargo loading.
4.8
Regulations:
Vessels should meet all DG (Shipping)/Government of India regulations.
The Circulars / Rules and regulations of DG (Shipping) / GoI shall be applicable.
4.9
Operational Tolerance:
The operational tolerance shall be applicable for each of the parcel mentioned against each of the aforementioned disports.
4.10
Coastal Conversion:
Time and cost of coastal conversion and re-conversion, if required, shall be to owner's account. NOR shall be tendered after coastal conversion.
4.11
Taxes:
All Taxes on earnings / freight / demurrage / dead-freight shall be on owners account & owners to make their own arrangement for making the payment in advance. Applicable Govt. Taxes to be paid by owners directly except GST on freight / demurrage / dead-freight, which shall be on Charterer’s account.
4.12
Lay time Exceptions:
Following activities shall not be considered in used time or time on demurrage:
a.    The vessel's proceeding from anchorage to the berth at each port of call.
b.    Placement of gangway.
c.    Handling of slops or ballast
d.    Any delay by ship in commencement of loading / discharge after the charterers conveying readiness for the operation.
e.    Inspection of the vessel tanks by independent surveyors at load-port.
f.     Pratique
g.    Customs clearance.
h.    Immigration Clearance
4.13
CP rider clause 16, additional wordings:
CP rider clause 16: Following shall be added at the end:  "At each discharge-port, lay time shall begin, subject to all other provisions of this agreement, upon the expiration of 6 hours after the tendering of Notice of Readiness or on commencement of discharging, whichever occurs first."
4.14
Priority Berthing:
In case Charterers request Owners for undertaking priority berthing at any port, the same shall be followed by Owners. Charterers shall reimburse the actual cost for priority berthing to Owners on production of the payment proof to port authorities.
4.15
Additional Documents alongwith Invoices:
Owners of foreign flag vessels must submit the following documents alongwith other required documents while submitting Freight/demurrage Invoices to Charterers:
No PE certificateTax Residency CertificateForm 10FPAN / Certificate in lieu of PAN (format enclosed)
4.16
LOI for Discharge:
LOI (in case of no original B/L) will be handed over at disport by IOC, Boarding Officer prior to commencement of discharge.
4.17
Coastal Trade Period:
Foreign flag owners to mention total period (in days) for which license has been issued/approved from DG shipping Mumbai for coastal trade in the current calendar year till date.
4.18
Last 3 Cargoes
Last three cargoes should preferably be Clean Petroleum Product.
4.19
Exchange Rate Clause:
Applicable to Indian flag ships/Indian owners only:
Freight/Demurrage/Dead Freight agreed upon under this Charter Party will be paid to Indian Owners in Indian rupees based on mean of TT buying and TT selling of USD/INR of  SBI (CAG Branch Mumbai)  prevailing on the date hose disconnection after completion of discharge, or if  this date is a bank holiday, the previous SBI working day on which such exchange rate is available, will be used for conversion.
4.20
Multiple Vessels
Charterers can consider more than one vessel against this enquiry.
4.21
Commissions
Address commission of 2.5% is payable by owners to Charterers on actual amount of freight/demurrage, as and when paid.
The brokerage commission on 100% gross amount of freight and dead-freight (if any) plus applicable GST due to the Indian broker under clause-J, part I of this charter party, will be deducted from the freight and paid to the broker direct in Indian rupees converted at the exchange rate ruling on the date of completion of discharge (i.e. hose disconnection) while remitting freight to the ship owners. Similarly, brokerage commission plus applicable GST on demurrage (if any) is to be deducted from the demurrage payable to the ship owners and paid to the Indian brokers at the time of remitting demurrage to the ship owners.
The exchange rate for brokerage payment shall be mean of TT buying and TT selling of USD/INR of  SBI (CAG Branch Mumbai)  prevailing on the date hose disconnection after completion of discharge, or if  this date is a bank holiday, the previous SBI working day on which such exchange rate is available, will be used for conversion.
4.22
GST Compliant Freight Invoice:
Vessel Owners shall raise separate freight & demurrage invoices in the proportion of the B/L quantity allocation for the respective disports, addressed to the concerned Port Locations, as advised by Charterers. Owners to raise disport wise invoices with GST Regn. of the respective states. Owners to quote IOC’s State GST Registration in the invoices. GST Circular enclosed.
4.23
COVID19 Clause:
In case any crew member/vessel is found infected with symptoms of corona virus, any waiting time including quarantine time at load/discharge port will not count as used lay time or time on demurrage and any waiting / delay/cost therein shall be strictly on owner's account.
4.24
Offer through Broking Channel
One Owner can submit offers through one broking channel only under any given enquiry.
